intro: Duguetia bracteosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Brazilian velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. Duguetia bracteosa is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in some regions.
